name: Chorba Hamra bel Frik (Algerian Lamb, Tomato, and Freekeh Soup)
author: salima1962
summary: This traditional Algerian soup is prepared every day during the month of Ramadan by most families. It is usually accompanied by briks or boreks.
ingredients: ¾ pound lamb meat, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
1 bunch fresh cilantro, finely chopped, divided
1 bunch fresh mint, finely chopped, divided
directions: Place freekeh in a bowl and cover with cold water
Combine lamb, onion, pepper, paprika, cinnamon, and salt in a pot
Add oil, 1/2 of the cilantro, 1/2 of the mint, and celery and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes
Stir in chickpeas and cover with a little water
Add tomato paste, zucchini, and carrot and mix well
Set a steamer over the pot and add tomatoes
Cover and steam tomatoes until soft, about 5 minutes
Crush tomatoes using a wooden spoon so pulp drips into the soup
Add potato and enough water to cover
Simmer until potato is soft, about 10 minutes
Drain freekeh and add to the soup
Sprinkle soup with remaining cilantro and mint before serving
